diagnosis.score_headline: The Queen Has Left The Building
diagnosis.score_summary: Your strategy relies on a charismatic Survivor (Dr. Marisol) and a cheeky, affectionate tone to elevate a commodity oil into a royal ritual. The PDP strips this humanity away, leaving a cold, clinical product that competes only on specs, dangerously eroding your premium brand aura.

uncomfortable_truths.headline: The Queen is Dead
uncomfortable_truths.description: Your Strategy is built on the 'Hero's Journey' of Dr. Marisol—a survivor who healed herself. On Amazon, she is reduced to a generic 'Naturopathic Doctor' credential. You have erased the protagonist, turning a deeply personal 'Cure' narrative into a cold 'Lab Breakthrough' that lacks emotional resonance.
uncomfortable_truths.why_matters: People trust people, especially in the 'natural cures' space. By hiding the founder's face and struggle, you lose the emotional hook that justifies the premium price. You become just another bottle of oil, rather than a ticket to the founder's healing circle.
uncomfortable_truths.action: Add a dedicated 'Meet Dr. Marisol' module in the A+ Content. Include her photo and a quote about her personal healing journey (liver/hormones) to restore the 'Survivor' authority.

uncomfortable_truths.headline: From Hugs to Handshakes
uncomfortable_truths.description: The website thermostat is set to 'Affectionate' (4/5), using emojis and 'love.' The PDP thermostat drops to 'Distant' (2/5) with phrases like 'The choice is clear' and 'Period.' You have shifted from a Trusted Friend who guides you to a Reliable Expert who lectures you.
uncomfortable_truths.why_matters: The brand's magic is the 'Queen of the Thrones' persona—regal but warm. The clinical coldness of the PDP makes the brand feel corporate and severe, alienating the customer looking for 'self-care' and 'love.'
uncomfortable_truths.action: Soften the copy in the 'About the Item' bullets. Replace the stern 'Period.' with warmer, benefit-driven language. Introduce the phrase 'Love your liver' into the hero image text.

uncomfortable_truths.headline: The Joke Didn't Land
uncomfortable_truths.description: Your Strategy permits a 'Cheeky' tone (4/5) that winks at the toilet/throne connection. The PDP flattens this to 'Grave' (1/5) and 'Neutral' (3/5). You've stripped out the wit that makes the brand name clever, leaving just the awkwardness of a 'Throne' reference without the punchline.
uncomfortable_truths.why_matters: Without the 'Cheeky' tone, the name 'Queen of the Thrones' risks sounding nonsensical or overly medieval rather than witty. The humor is a key differentiator in a category (laxatives/detox) that is usually embarrassing.
uncomfortable_truths.action: Inject one moment of 'Cheeky' wit into the A+ Content header or the second image text—a subtle nod to the 'Royal Flush' or 'Throne' concept to bridge the gap between medical and playful.

uncomfortable_truths.headline: Magic Fades to Safety
uncomfortable_truths.description: Your Archetype mix is 90% aligned, but the Tertiary element has drifted. Strategy holds 'The Magician' (15%)—the promise of transformation and ancient ritual. PDP swaps this for 'The Caregiver' (15%)—mere protection. You are dangerously close to losing the 'Alchemy' that makes the product exciting.
uncomfortable_truths.why_matters: If you lose the Magician, you lose the mystique. You become a commodity safety product ('it won't hurt you') rather than a transformative one ('it will change you'). 'Safe' is boring; 'Magical' is viral.
uncomfortable_truths.action: Revise the 'How to Use' module to frame the application as a 'Ritual' rather than just 'Instructions.' Use words like 'transform,' 'ancient practice,' and 'awaken' to revive the Magician archetype.

uncomfortable_truths.headline: Weaponize The Glass
uncomfortable_truths.description: You are perfectly aligned on Self-Expression (The Purist). The 'Amber Glass' is your strongest signaling asset, hitting 4/5 on 'The Statement.' You are currently stating it, but you could be *shouting* it. The glass bottle is the ultimate anti-plastic status symbol.
uncomfortable_truths.evidence: [SELF-EXPRESSION] Alignment: 100% | Opportunity: Push 'The Statement' from 4/5 to 5/5
uncomfortable_truths.why_matters: The 'Plastic vs. Glass' debate is a major emotional wedge. You have the opportunity to make owning a plastic bottle of castor oil feel shameful. By amplifying this signal, you turn your packaging into a moral victory for the customer.
uncomfortable_truths.action: Create a comparison chart in the A+ Content specifically attacking plastic: 'Glass (Pure) vs. Plastic (Leeching).' Visually dramatize the 'purity' of the glass bottle in a luxury bathroom setting to maximize the status signal.

markers_analysis.www_position: The Harmonizer (Natural Balance) | Origin: 4/5 Bio-Active, Mission: 2/5 Restoration
markers_analysis.pdp_position: The Harmonizer (Natural Balance) | Origin: 4/5 Bio-Active, Mission: 2/5 Restoration
markers_analysis.so_what: Perfect alignment. Both channels anchor on 'Bio-Active' authority and a mission of 'Restoration.' The brand consistently promises to fix broken systems (liver/lymph) using nature's power.

markers_analysis.www_position: The Earth Saviors (Accessible Global Mission) | Scope: 3/5 Lifestyle, Access: 4/5 Approachable
markers_analysis.pdp_position: The Democratizers (Accessible Wellness) | Scope: 3/5 Lifestyle, Access: 4/5 Approachable
markers_analysis.so_what: Major Strategic Fracture. The website frames the mission as saving the earth/body (Saviors), while Amazon frames it as democratizing clinic products (Democratizers). The 'Why' has been lost in translation.

markers_analysis.www_position: Safety First (The Safe Harbor) | Priority: 1/5 Hypoallergenic, Info: 1/5 Spec Sheet
markers_analysis.pdp_position: Safety First (The Safe Harbor) | Priority: 1/5 Hypoallergenic, Info: 3/5 Explained
markers_analysis.so_what: Territory holds, but execution drifts. WWW is paranoid with a 'Spec Sheet' (1/5), while Amazon tries to explain the science (3/5). The core 'Safety' value remains intact, but the PDP is more educational.

markers_analysis.www_position: The Scientific Miracle (The Expensive Cure) | Aesthetic: 2/5 Professional, Value: 4/5 Aspirational
markers_analysis.pdp_position: The Medical Authority (Alternative Medicine) | Aesthetic: 2/5 Professional, Value: 3/5 Masstige
markers_analysis.so_what: Strategic erosion. The website sells an 'Aspirational' miracle; Amazon sells a 'Masstige' medical product. You are trading pricing power and allure for clinical functionality.

markers_analysis.www_position: The Trusted Friend (Sincerity) | Thermostat: 4/5 Affectionate, Power: 3/5 The Guide
markers_analysis.pdp_position: The Reliable Expert (Competence) | Thermostat: 2/5 Distant, Power: 4/5 The Specialist
markers_analysis.so_what: Total personality transplant. The 'Affectionate' friend from the website becomes a 'Distant' specialist on Amazon. The warmth and emojis are replaced by cold, hard rules.

markers_analysis.www_position: The Stabilizers | Primary: Ruler, Secondary: Sage, Tertiary: Magician
markers_analysis.pdp_position: The Stabilizers | Primary: Ruler, Secondary: Sage, Tertiary: Caregiver
markers_analysis.so_what: Strong core alignment on Ruler/Sage. The drift is in the tertiary: Strategy uses 'Magician' (Transformative), PDP uses 'Caregiver' (Protective). You are slightly safer and less magical on Amazon.

markers_analysis.www_position: The Gentle Guide (Warm & Helpful) | Humor: 3/5, Formality: 3/5, Respect: 4/5, Enthusiasm: 4/5
markers_analysis.pdp_position: The Clinical Authority (Academic & Dry) | Humor: 1/5, Formality: 3/5, Respect: 3/5, Enthusiasm: 2/5
markers_analysis.so_what: Voice collapse. The 'Cheeky' and 'Enthusiastic' tone of the brand strategy is completely flattened into a 'Grave' and 'Dry' clinical voice on Amazon. The brand sounds like a warning label.

markers_analysis.www_position: The Traditionalist (Heritage) | Thermostat: 5/5 Hot, Entropy: 2/5 Structured
markers_analysis.pdp_position: The Traditionalist (Heritage) | Thermostat: 3/5 Neutral, Entropy: 2/5 Structured
markers_analysis.so_what: Territory holds. The 'Traditionalist' look remains, but the visual temperature cools from 'Hot' (Rich Gold/Purple) to 'Neutral' (Amber/Blue) on Amazon. The luxury feel is slightly diluted.

markers_analysis.www_position: The Chemist (Intellectual) | Hook: 2/5 Component, Persuasion: 2/5 Rational
markers_analysis.pdp_position: The Chemist (Intellectual) | Hook: 2/5 Component, Persuasion: 2/5 Rational
markers_analysis.so_what: Perfect match. Both channels lead with the 'Component' (Oil, Bottle, Hexane) and use 'Rational' arguments to close the sale. The logic of the pitch is consistent.

markers_analysis.www_position: The Personal Cure (Empathetic) | Protagonist: 5/5 The Survivor, Setting: 4/5 Harvest
markers_analysis.pdp_position: The Lab Breakthrough (Intellectual) | Protagonist: 2/5 The Professional, Setting: 2/5 Tech-Forward
markers_analysis.so_what: Complete narrative rupture. The founder's powerful 'Survivor' story is erased on Amazon, replaced by a generic 'Professional' credential. The setting shifts from nature ('Harvest') to machinery ('Tech-Forward').

markers_analysis.www_position: Formula Purity (Safety) | Validator: 1/5 The Board, Proof: 4/5 The List
markers_analysis.pdp_position: Formula Purity (Safety) | Validator: 2/5 The Lab, Proof: 4/5 The List
markers_analysis.so_what: Strong alignment. 'The List' (Free-from claims) is the primary proof point on both channels. Validator drifts slightly from 'Board' to 'Lab,' but the core argument of purity remains intact.

markers_analysis.www_position: The Ingredient King (Raw Material) | Ownership: 1/5 Commodity, Scope: 3/5 Category
markers_analysis.pdp_position: The Ingredient King (Raw Material) | Ownership: 2/5 Hero, Scope: 3/5 Category
markers_analysis.so_what: Healthy. The brand aims to be the King of Castor Oil. Amazon pushes slightly harder on 'Hero' ownership (2/5) than the website (1/5), which is a positive drift for the PDP.

markers_analysis.www_position: Science Education (Mechanism) | Depth: 2/5 Explainer, Intent: 1/5 The Thesis
markers_analysis.pdp_position: Science Education (Mechanism) | Depth: 2/5 Explainer, Intent: 1/5 The Thesis
markers_analysis.so_what: Aligned. Both channels prioritize 'Explainer' content to educate the user. The intent is consistently to build a thesis around quality rather than just showcase lifestyle.

markers_analysis.www_position: Restoration (Recovery) | Action: 5/5 The Fixer, Outcome: 1/5 Biological
markers_analysis.pdp_position: Restoration (Recovery) | Action: 4/5 The Healer, Outcome: 1/5 Biological
markers_analysis.so_what: Strong alignment. The product is consistently sold as a biological restoration tool. The website promises slightly more aggressive 'Fixing' (5/5) than Amazon's 'Healing' (4/5), but the territory is solid.

markers_analysis.www_position: Relief / Safety (Calm) | Anxiety: 2/5 Reassurance, Self-Perception: 1/5 Sanctuary
markers_analysis.pdp_position: Relief / Safety (Calm) | Anxiety: 2/5 Reassurance, Self-Perception: 1/5 Sanctuary
markers_analysis.so_what: Perfect sync. The emotional hook is fear reduction ('Reassurance') leading to a feeling of 'Sanctuary.' The brand knows it is selling safety in a toxic world.

markers_analysis.www_position: The Purist (Ethics) | Signal: 4/5 The Statement, Tribal: 3/5 The Curated
markers_analysis.pdp_position: The Purist (Ethics) | Signal: 4/5 The Statement, Tribal: 3/5 The Curated
markers_analysis.so_what: Locked in. The user buys this to make a 'Statement' about purity (Glass > Plastic). The brand successfully signals ethical superiority on both channels.

markers_analysis.www_position: The Knowledge Club (Intellect) | Social: 4/5 Distinction, Group: 4/5 The Club
markers_analysis.pdp_position: The Knowledge Club (Intellect) | Social: 4/5 Distinction, Group: 4/5 The Club
markers_analysis.so_what: Aligned. Both channels position the customer as a member of 'The Club'—educated insiders who know better than the mainstream. This drives high loyalty.
